name: Reba! Reba! Reba! Quiz / Test | Music | 15 Questions

questions.text: Why did the lights go out in Georgia?
options: someone forgot to turn on the lights
questions.explanation:
her brother was hung.

	Released on October 1, 1991. A video accompanies the song.

questions.text: Finish the lyrics: "Nothing feels as good as ..."
questions.explanation:
letting go.

	'Nothing feels as good as letting go' is a verse from the song 'Fallin' Out of Love'. No video accompanies the song.

questions.text: Who was Reba singing to in the song 'If You See Him, If You See Her'?
questions.explanation:
Brooks and Dunn.

	'If You See Him, If You See Her' came out on June 2, 1998. Brooks and Dunn also have the song on their CD. A video accompanies the song.

questions.text: What male country singer sang in the duet 'The Heart Won't Lie'?
questions.explanation:
Vince Gill.

	'The Heart Won't Lie' came out on December 15, 1992. Vince Gill also has the song on his CD. A video accompanies the song.

questions.text: Is this line correct? 'There is one that never leaves her thoughts and she thinks his name is Narvel'.
questions.explanation:
False.

	'There is one that never leaves her thoughts and she thinks his name is John.' 'She Thinks His Name is John' came out on April 26, 1996. Her performance on the CMA's makes for the video of the song.

questions.text: In which WB series is the song 'I'm A Survivor' played?
questions.explanation:
Reba.

	The song is the theme for the show; the last line of the chorus was sung by Melissa Peterman when she was sweeping the floor.

questions.text: This song was played in a movie that starred Tim Matheson and Reba McEntire.
questions.explanation:
Forever Love.

	'Forever Love' came out on June 2, 1998. A video with excerpts from the movie accompanies the song.

Kenny Rogers.

	The song and video came out in 2002.

questions.text: Finish the lyric: 'The heart is a ..."
questions.explanation:
lonely hunter.

	'The Heart is A Lonely Hunter' came out on April 26, 1994. No video accompanies the song.

questions.text: Finish the lyric: 'I couldn't move and all I could feel was this aching in my heart saying I loved him ______'
questions.explanation:
still.

	'And Still' came out on April 26, 1994. A video accompanies the song.

questions.text: 'Take it Back' was on which of Reba's records?
questions.explanation:
'It's Your Call'.

	'Take it Back' came out on December 15, 1992. A video accompanies the song.

questions.text: What song is this lyric from: 'That the world still turns and the sun still burns'?
options: 'The Night The Lights Went Out in Georgia'
questions.explanation:
'Myself Without You'.

	'Myself Without You' is a new addition to the 'REBA III' CD.

questions.text: When does Reba say the telephone was invented?
questions.explanation:
1876.

	'Back in 1876 an old boy named Bell invented a contraption that we know so well' is the first line of 'Why Haven't I Heard From You?'. The song came out on April 26, 1994, and a video accompanied it.

questions.text: 'Fallin out of love and back into your life' is the first line of the chorus from 'Fallin' Out Of Love'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	'Fallin' out of and back into your life' is the first line of the chours of 'Fallin' Out Of Love'.

questions.text: Finish the lyric: 'It's just the fear of being _______'
questions.explanation:
alone.

	'The Fear of Being Alone' came out on November 5, 1996. A video accompanies the song.
